text: Desmoxytes rhinoceros is an aposematic species of dragon millipede in the genus Desmoxytes. It is only known from Champasak and Sekong Provinces in southern Laos. It was first described, along with D. rhinoparva, in 2015. Both species were discovered in Laos, the first dragon millipedes identified there, D. rhinoceros in the south of the country and D. rhinoparva in the north. The holotype is in the Museum of Zoology, Chulalongkorn University, Bangkok, Thailand. The body length is in males and in females. The color is dark red. == References == rhinoceros Category:Animals described in 2015 Category:Millipedes of Asia Category:Arthropods of Laos Category:Endemic fauna of Laos
title: Desmoxytes rhinoceros
